intro: Dolichocarpa crouchiana, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hairy seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its unique nocturnal blooming habit, it is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
